009package imagingbook.violajones.lib;
010
011import java.util.LinkedList;
012import java.util.List;
013
014import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.image.IntegralImage;
016import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
017
018/**
019 * The core class.
020 * TODO: change constructors to use the source image, pre-calculate everything.
021 * TODO: use annotations on Parameters fields
022 * 
023 * @author W. Burger
024 * @version 2022/04/15
025 */
026public class FaceDetector {
027        
028        /**
029         * Nested class representing parameters and their default values.
030         */
031        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle {
032                /** The initial ratio between the window size and the Haar classifier size (default 2). */
033                public double baseScale = 2.00;
034                
035                /** The scale increment of the window size, at each step (default 1.25). */
036                public double scaleStep = 1.25;
037                
038                /** The shift of the window at each sub-step, in terms of percentage of the window size. */
039                public double winShiftFraction = 0.1;
040                
041                /** The minimum number of rectangles needed for the corresponding detection to be kept */
042                public int minNeighbors = 1;
043                
044                /** Flag indicating if Canny pruning should be applied. */
045                public boolean doGradientPruning = false;
046                
047                /** The minimum percentage of overlap for merging two regions. */
048                public double minMergeRegionOverlap = 0.2;
049                
050                /** The width of the Gaussian blur applied before gradient calculation. */
051                public double gradientSigma = 2.0;
052                
053                /** The minimum (normalized) gradient magnitude if pruning is on. */
054                public double minGradientMagnitude = 20;
055                
056                /** The maximum (normalized) gradient magnitude if pruning is on. */
057                public double maxGradientMagnitude = 100;
058        }
059        
060        private final Parameters params;
061        private final HaarCascadeDescriptor cascade;
062        
063        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
064        
065        /**
066         *  The only constructor.
067         * @param cascade a Haar cascade descriptor
068         * @param params a parameter object (default settings are used if {@code null} is passed)
069         */
070        public FaceDetector(HaarCascadeDescriptor cascade, Parameters params) {
071                this.cascade = cascade;
072                this.params = (params != null) ? params : new Parameters();
073        }
074        
075        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
076
077        /**
078         * Detects faces in the supplied image.
079         * @param ip the input image
080         * @return the list of rectangles containing searched objects
081         */
082        public List<FaceRegion> findFaces(ByteProcessor ip) {
083                return findFaces(ip.getIntArray());
084        }
085        
086        public List<FaceRegion> findFaces(int[][] I) {
087                List<FaceRegion> facelist = new LinkedList<FaceRegion>();
088                final int imgW = I.length;
089                final int imgH = I[0].length;
090        
091                // maximum size of detector is the whole image 
092                double maxScale = Math.min(
093                                (double) imgW / cascade.getWidth(),
094                                (double) imgH / cascade.getHeight());
095                
096                //IJ.log("maxScale = " + maxScale);
097
098                IntegralImage II = new IntegralImage(I);
099
100                // precalculate Canny edges if option is on
101                //int[][] canny = null;
102                IntegralImage canny = null;
103                if (params.doGradientPruning) {
104                        //canny = CannyPruner.getIntegralCanny(I);
105                        canny = Gradient.makeGradientIntegral(I, params.gradientSigma);
106                }
107
108                // apply the detector at each scale:
109                double scale = params.baseScale;
110                while (scale < maxScale) {
111                        //IJ.log("scale = " + scale);
112                        // calculate the sliding step of the window in each direction:
113                        final int uStep = (int) Math.round(scale * cascade.getWidth() * params.winShiftFraction);
114                        final int vStep = (int) Math.round(scale * cascade.getHeight() * params.winShiftFraction);
115                        final int curW =  (int) Math.round(scale * cascade.getWidth());
116                        final int curH =  (int) Math.round(scale * cascade.getHeight());
117        
118                        // check each position of the window on the image:
119                        for (int v = 0; v < imgH - curH; v += vStep) {
120                                for (int u = 0; u < imgW - curW; u += uStep) {
121                                        /*
122                                         * If Canny pruning is on, compute the edge density of the
123                                         * zone. If it is too low, the object should not be there so
124                                         * skip the region.
125                                         */
126                                        if (params.doGradientPruning) {
127                                                //int edges_density = canny[u + curW][v + curH] + canny[u][v] - canny[u][v + curH] - canny[u + curW][v];
128                                                double gradientMag = canny.getBlockSum1(u, v, u + curW - 1, v + curH - 1);
129                                                double d = gradientMag / (curW * curH);
130                                                if (d < params.minGradientMagnitude || d > params.maxGradientMagnitude)
131                                                        continue;       // skip this region
132                                        }
133                                        
134                                        // apply each detector stage to the current window, reject if one stage fails
135                                        boolean pass = true;
136                                        for (Stage stage : cascade.getStages()) {
137                                                if (!stage.pass(II, u, v, scale)) {
138                                                        pass = false;
139                                                        break;
140                                                }
141                                        }
142                                        // if current window passed all stages, add to the results
143                                        if (pass) {
144                                                facelist.add(new FaceRegion(u, v, curW, curH));
145                                        }
146                                }
147                        }
148                        scale = scale * params.scaleStep;
149                }
150
151                return merge(facelist.toArray(new FaceRegion[0]),
152                                params.minNeighbors, params.minMergeRegionOverlap);
153        }
154                
155        /**
156         * Merge the raw detections resulting from the detection step to avoid
157         * multiple detections of the same object. A threshold on the minimum
158         * numbers of rectangles that need to be merged for the resulting detection
159         * to be kept can be given, to lower the rate of false detections. Two
160         * rectangles need to be merged if they overlap enough.
161         * TODO: CHECK!! Make rectangles immutable!
162         * 
163         * @param facesInit the raw detections returned by the detection algorithm
164         * @param min_neighbors the minimum number of rectangles needed for the corresponding detection to be kept
165         * @param minOverlap the minimum overlap required for merging two faces
166         * @return The merged rectangular detections.
167         */
168        protected List<FaceRegion> merge(FaceRegion[] facesInit, int min_neighbors, double minOverlap) {
169                List<FaceRegion> facesMerged = new LinkedList<FaceRegion>();
170                int[] result = new int[facesInit.length];
171                int nb_classes = 0;
172                for (int i = 0; i < facesInit.length; i++) {
173                        boolean found = false;
174                        for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
175                                if (facesInit[j].overlaps(facesInit[i], minOverlap)) {
176                                        found = true;
177                                        result[i] = result[j];
178                                }
179                        }
180                        if (!found) {
181                                result[i] = nb_classes;
182                                nb_classes++;
183                        }
184                }
185                int[] neighbors = new int[nb_classes];
186                FaceRegion[] facesTmp = new FaceRegion[nb_classes];
187                
188                for (int i = 0; i < nb_classes; i++) {
189                        neighbors[i] = 0;
190                        facesTmp[i] = new FaceRegion(0, 0, 0, 0);       // TODO: make more efficient/polish!
191                }
192                
193                for (int i = 0; i < facesInit.length; i++) {
194                        neighbors[result[i]]++;
195                        int x = facesTmp[result[i]].x + facesInit[i].x;
196                        int y = facesTmp[result[i]].y + facesInit[i].y;
197                        int w = facesTmp[result[i]].height + facesInit[i].height;
198                        int h = facesTmp[result[i]].width + facesInit[i].width;
199                        facesTmp[result[i]] = new FaceRegion(x, y, w, h);
200                }
201                
202                for (int i = 0; i < nb_classes; i++) {
203                        int n = neighbors[i];
204                        if (n >= min_neighbors) {
205                                int x = (facesTmp[i].x * 2 + n) / (2 * n);
206                                int y = (facesTmp[i].y * 2 + n) / (2 * n);
207                                int w = (facesTmp[i].width * 2 + n) / (2 * n);
208                                int h = (facesTmp[i].height * 2 + n) / (2 * n);
209                                facesMerged.add(new FaceRegion(x, y, w, h));
210                        }
211                }
212                
213                return facesMerged;
214        }
215
216}
